content:

title: Login & Password
content:
Hello,

today i started Firefox as usual and realized that there was an issue with my Firefox account. I couldn't log into an account with the saved Password feature, my account couldn't sync for some reason and was logged out of my account. I think i saved the Password for my Firefox account in the Firefox Browser or I've forgotten it, in any case i reset my password of my Firefox account. After i logged in again i saw the all my saved Passwords, that should have been saved in Firefox, disappeared.

Now my question, how can i restore them? I saved many important Passwords, so its quite significant that i get them back...

Are you mad because I switched to Opera GX? if you can help me restore them I come back to team Firefox, i swear.

Thanks in advance

chrismoeslang

creator: clementberne

title: Firefox and windows 10 or 11 speedtest issue
content:
Today I decided to contact my ISP, Verizon.com, because when I run their speedtest at verizon.com/speedtest I have issues. Their speedtest has 3 tests it runs. 1. Up/download speeds, 2. My device to FIOS and 3. a Wifi Analysis. When running this test using Firefox v102.14 on a brand new, fresh Win11 pc, the test gets through the up/download test then hangs at the 2nd test. I have tried this same test using 2 cell phones, a tablet and a laptop. They all proceeded through all tests with no issues (Using Firefox). I connected my pc direct to the router and the test did not run to completion. It hang on test 2 (again, using Firefox). I then started MS Edge and ran the same test from this PC and it worked fine. So from my tests, it appears as if there is an issue with Firefox. My old pc using windows 10 had the same issue. When the same issue happens on a brand new pc with Windows 11 preinstalled, it seems like a FF problem.

Old PC AMD FX8320, 16gb DDR3 memory and 1TB SSD HD

New PC AMD Ryzen 7 4700G with 32gb DDR4 memory and a 512GB NVME drive. Both are connected to the internet using Cat 6 ethernet cables.

title: How to completely disable all translations globally
content:
With a recent update of Firefox Developer Edition to version 117.0b9 i keep getting extremely annoying popups on all sites, asking me if I want to translate stuff.

I don't want to store unnecessary settings in my browser, related to exceptions to websites/languages that I want vs. does not want to translate.

I want to completely disable translations, globally. Forever. Two questions:

- Why there is no "disable translations globally" checkbox in the newly added popup? - Is there an about:config hack to do disable translations globally, for all languages, for all websites, and forever?

thanks in advance

title: Remove Microsoft Login credentials on Firefox
content:
I am trying to remove my login details on firefox for my microsft account. Everytime I try i go to www.office.com or portal.office.com to log into my account the username for the account is always displayed.

I have gone on the the privacy and setting and removed all cached data, removed history and cache when closing firefox.

But everytime I go to the website to log onto my microsoft account the account user name remains. Is there a way of removing this information. I ahve also cleared auto.fill and disabled this within the about:config.

Could anyone advise me how this can be done as I cannot seem to find anyother settings that I may have to change for this to be done!

Thanks!

title: Cannot connet to WebAppAgent to use Protheus 12 - Não consigo me conectar ao WebAppAgent Protheus 12
content:
Portugues

Prezados bom dia. Estou tentando utilizar um sistema de homologação do Protheus P12 no meu Firefox, versão 109. Por algum motivo, não consigo me conectar nele, mesmo ele sendo local e ele é necessário para que eu acesse a nova release do Protheus e teste o ambiente.

Importante ressaltar que no Chrome não tenho esse problema, o site carrega direto mas gostaria de usar o Firefox.

Alguma sugestão?

Estarei anexando prints.

Inglês

Dears, good morning. I'm trying to use a Protheus P12 homologation system in my Firefox, version 109. For some reason, I can't connect to it, even though it's local and it's necessary for me to access the new Protheus release and test the environment.

It is important to note that in Chrome I do not have this problem, the site loads directly but I would like to use Firefox.

Any suggestion?

I will be attaching prints.

title: Videos Lag when Mouse Over Windows 11 Taskbar
content:
I recently had to perform a system restore on my Laptop to resolve an issue (on recommendation from ASUS Support).

On reinstalling firefox, I began to notice that video (Youtube, Animated GIF's, etc) would lag when I would scroll my mouse down to the Windows 11 Taskbar and it would show the preview windows.

Firefox is the only application that is having this issue, and Troubleshoot Mode seems to not have the problem. However, when not in troubleshoot mode, even with all Add-On's and Themes disabled, the issue occurs.

I have tried changing Add-Ons to ones with rated performance, restarting my Laptop, ensuring all Drivers, Applications are updated, Refreshing Firefox, uninstalling & reinstalling firefox, reducing the number of open tabs and windows. I also ran sfc /scannow and DISM in case the issue was with the taskbar, with nothing being reported. Nothing appears to have worked.

Any assistance would be appreciated, as I love using Firefox and have not had any issues with it up until now.
creator: aidanshort
